intro: Moussonia larryskogii, commonly known as the Larryskog's moussonia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
